gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: PERSIANN Precipitation Climate Data Record (PERSIANN-CDR) is a daily quasi-global precipitation product for the period of 1982 to the present (note that there is a delay in data availability due to processing and data input availability). The data covers from 60 degrees S to 60 degrees N and 0 degrees to 360 degrees longitude at 0.25 degree spatial resolution. The product is developed using Gridded Satellite (GridSat-B1) IR data that are derived from merging ISCCP B1 IR data, along with GPCP version 2.2.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This dataset provides a high quality Climate Data Record (CDR) of precipitation. Data are intended to support Climatologists, Hydrologists, Hydrometeorologists, and Hydroclimatologists in various forms of climate research, including extreme event (flood and drought) analysis.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Cite this dataset when used as a source: Sorooshian, Soroosh; Hsu, Kuolin; Braithwaite, Dan; Ashouri, Hamed; and NOAA CDR Program (2014): NOAA Climate Data Record (CDR) of Precipitation Estimation from Remotely Sensed Information using Artificial Neural Networks (PERSIANN-CDR), Version 1 Revision 1. [indicate subset used]. NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information. doi:10.7289/V51V5BWQ [access date].

Publications using this dataset should also cite the following journal article: Ashouri H., K. Hsu, S. Sorooshian, D. K. Braithwaite, K. R. Knapp, L. D. Cecil, B. R. Nelson, and O. P. Prat, 2015: PERSIANN-CDR: Daily Precipitation Climate Data Record from Multi-Satellite Observations for Hydrological and Climate Studies. Bull. Amer. Meteor. Soc., doi: https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-13-00068.1.
See the Use Agreement for this CDR available on the CDR page.

Distribution liability: NOAA and NCEI make no warranty, expressed or implied, regarding these data, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty. NOAA and NCEI cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in these data. If appropriate, NCEI can only certify that the data it distributes are an authentic copy of the records that were accepted for inclusion in the NCEI archives.

Use liability: NOAA and NCEI cannot provide any warranty as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of furnished data. Users assume responsibility to determine the usability of these data. The user is responsible for the results of any application of this data for other than its intended purpose.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The data were produced by the University of California at Irvine, and are archived at the NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI). The initial release of PERSIANN (V01r00) incorporated bad/noisy data from the input source (GridSat-B1 IRWIN), resulting in the dataset needing to be re-processed. Version v01r00 of PERSIANN is not available from the Archive. However, PERSIANN-CDR v01r01, the current PERSIANN-CDR, is based on version v2 of the GridSat CDR which contains fewer issues.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: For a description of the processing steps, see the Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document and Data Flow Diagram for this dataset.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: University of California at Irvine

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This source code is for reference only. The source code is provided to maintain transparency of the algorithm and processes used in creating the Climate Data Record (CDR). The source code is not intended to be portable to any computer system(s) beyond that of the original CDR producer's environment.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: ATBD for the CDR product.
ISCCP GridSat-B1 provides a uniform set of quality controlled observations for the infrared (IR) window channel at 11 microns for a 30 year record beginning in 1980.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The Data Stewardship Maturity Matrix (DSMM) is a unified framework that defines criteria for each of nine components based on measurable practices, which can be used to apply a progressive, 6-level rating to an individual dataset, representing stewardship maturity stages rated as Not Assessed or Not Available (Level 0), adHoc (Level 1), minimum (Level 2), intermediate (Level 3), advanced (Level 4), and optimal (Level 5).

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment was evaluated by the metadata content editor for the NOAA OneStop project using the Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template v4.0.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: The Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: CICS-NC/NCEI

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: The Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Landing page for quality evaluation procedure.
